question: 2. As ankles should not be hidden, what r da rulings regarding Long boots & joggers which cover da ankles? & if we r wearing ankle high trousers can we wear socks?
answer:
QUESTION
1. My previous Question # 12051. Not answered as yet. 2. As ankles should not be hidden, what r da rulings regarding Long boots & joggers which cover da ankles? & if we r wearing ankle high trousers can we wear socks? 3. While wearing pant shirt, my trousers r ankle high, wt about shirt, should it be tucked in or left tucked out 4. I am working in Dubai, in a newspaper. Our MD is an Arab Muslim but majority of management is Non muslim. I want to try and quit wearing pant shirt and start wearing Kandoorah which according to HR dept. is allowed to wear for expats too only when higher management approves. What should I do? Shall I proceed further and give them the application for the same. I want 2 follow da Sunnah as much as I can. Pls. advise. 5. What if I want to have a child only after a year or two after my marriage as my idea is to first spend some quality time with my wife alone. I believe she had spent plenty of years in her home and she must be treated lovably and gently to adjust in the new environment. Having a child in the very first year might be a little too much for her. That?s what I think. So wt should be done? & re dere ways 2 avoid having a child in da 1st 2 years (usage or condom/medication to avoid pregnancy). I know the hadith in which Nabi SAWS told a person that when Allah wants to give birth to child nothing can come in between as the person did azal with his wife or baandi and still she got pregnant. Pls. advise in the light of Quran and Sunnah.
ANSWER


Share:
1. Your question will be answered to shortly.

2. It is permissible to cover the ankles with socks, boots, etc. The impermissibility applies to clothes which are worn from the above the ankle and then hang over the ankle.

3. Your shirt should be tucked it.

4. We are unaware of what a Kaudoorah is. However, if it is an Islamic form of dress, you should apply to wear it.

5. Q: Are contraceptions permissible?
A: All forms of reversible contraception (e.g. condoms, IUD, etc.) are permissible on condition that it is not used out of fear of poverty and also that it is consentual between husband and wife.
Hadhrat Abu Saéed Khudhry (RA) reports that one person asked Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Álayhi Wasallam) about Azal (Coitus Interruptus). Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Álayhi Wasallam) replied, 'When Allah Taãla intends creating a child, nothing can stop him.' (Mishkãt pg. 275; Qadeemi)

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Des
